title.narrative: WB Water Resources and Irrigation Project (WRIP)

description.narrative: (i) establish the strategic framework to manage water resources at the national level and at thelevel of the Drin-Buna and Semani River basins and (ii) improving, in a sustainable manner, the performance of Selected Irrigation Systems.

Det föreslagna projektet kommer att bestå av komponenter som behandlar 1) Reneovering av bevattningsystem 2) Institutionellt och produktivt stöd för bevattning och dränering 3) Institutionellt stöd till för integrerad vattenförvaltning och 4) Genomförande stöd. Genomförande-parters kommer att vara Jordbruksministeriet och Miljöministeriet. Sverige stödjer fra komp 3, dvs EU:s Vattendirektiv

The proposed project will comprise components dealing with 1) Irrigation systems rehabilitation 2) Institutional and productive support for irrigation and drainage 3) Institutional support to for Integrated Water Resources Management and 4) Implementation support. Implementation partners will be Min of Agriculture and Min of Environment. Sweden to support Component 3 which relates to EU WFD

participating-org.narrative: IBRD/International Bank for Reconstruction and Development/The World Bank
IBRD/International Bank for Reconstruction and Development/The World Bank

sector.narrative: Water sector policy and administrative management

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Results (related to the Swedish financed componet on water resources management): 1. Two River Basin Management Plans (RBMPs) have been drafted and were later approved. 2. A first version of the water cadaster (information system) has been developed. 3. A national Integrated Water Resources Management Strategy (IWRM strategy) was developed and approved by the government.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
